CatDescriptText: Iola Palmer, housewife, 364 -1/2 Independence Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?"  Answer reads: "I believe that young single women would make the better teachers.  This would open up more jobs for this class.  In my opinion, a married woman should not have to work because she has her husband to support her.  Frankly, I can't say why, but I prefer ladies over men to teach elementary grades."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Iola Palmer wearing floral sleeveless dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
